content:
• Thursday, December 13, 2012
  • INFA

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) has rallied 10% over the last 2 days in the absence of major news. The...

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) has rallied 10% over the last 2 days in the absence of major news. The data warehousing software firm was crushed in October thanks to a Q3 warning, and has been pressured since by bad news from peers and the introduction of Amazon's Redshift cloud warehousing service. Following today's close, Informatica announced it has named former H-P exec Margaret Breya its new marketing chief - the company has struggled with sales execution issues this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:34 PM
  • AVG

    AVG Technologies (NYSE:AVG) +4.4% AH after announcing a deal with Yahoo (YHOO) to integrate the...

    AVG Technologies (NYSE:AVG) +4.4% AH after announcing a deal with Yahoo (YHOO) to integrate the latter's search engine with its AVG Secure Search toolbar, which has inspired plenty of discussion threads from users looking to get rid of it after an unintended install. AVG will presumably be paid traffic acquisition fees from Yahoo.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • TSLA

    Though underwriters might not brag too much about it given the circumstances, SolarCity (SCTY)...

    Though underwriters might not brag too much about it given the circumstances, SolarCity (SCTY) finished the day at $11.79, up 47.4% from its $8 IPO price. CEO Lyndon Rive predicts the money-losing company will turn cash flow positive by the end of 2013. Bloomberg's Cory Johnson notes SolarCity is dependent on a 30% tax credit that (unless extended) falls to 10% in 2017, and is being investigated by the Treasury Department and DOJ. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • VGZ

    Vista Gold (NYSEMKT:VGZ) -11.2% AH after the miner announces a public offering of an unspecified...

    Vista Gold (NYSEMKT:VGZ) -11.2% AH after the miner announces a public offering of an unspecified number of units. Net proceeds will be used for ongoing technical evaluations and engineering studies, exploration and resource conversion drilling and water treatment at the Mt. Todd gold project in Australia, and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • ADBE

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ADBE +5%. SCVL +2%. GWAY +2%. ONNN +2%. AVGO...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ADBE +5%. SCVL +2%. GWAY +2%. ONNN +2%. AVGO +2%.
    After-hours top losers: ZQK -14%. CYTX -13%. VGZ -9%. PAY -6%. TSON -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • CIS

    Camelot Information Systems (NYSE:CIS): Q3 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $63M (+15.7%...

    Camelot Information Systems (NYSE:CIS): Q3 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $63M (+15.7% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) +5.2% AH after resuming trading following its FQ4 beat. Deferred revenue...

    Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) +5.2% AH after resuming trading following its FQ4 beat. Deferred revenue rose by $59.3M Q/Q to $619.6M, reversing an FQ3 decline. Creative Cloud subs were added at a rate of 10K/week (up from FQ3's 8K/week), as implied by recent figures. Thanks to a shift to subscription sales, FQ1 guidance (in prepared remarks) is for revenue of $950M-$1B and EPS of $0.26-$0.32, below a consensus of $1.07B and $0.56. And FY13 guidance is for revenue of $4.1B and EPS of $1.40, below a consensus of $4.35B and $2.31. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (datasheet) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • XPER

    Tessera (TSRA) -6.9% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $50M-$53M, well below the $73.5M...

    Tessera (TSRA) -6.9% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $50M-$53M, well below the $73.5M estimated by the one analyst who covers the company. Chip packaging IP revenue is expected to fall to $42M-$43M from Q3's $57.9M, and camera module sales to $8M-$10M from Q3's $14.8M. No explanation is given for the warning, which is harsh even in light of the ones recently issued by Altera and Lattice Semi.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • PAY

    More on VeriFone: FQ1 guidance is for revenue of $490M-$500M and EPS of $0.70-$0.73, largely...

    More on VeriFone: FQ1 guidance is for revenue of $490M-$500M and EPS of $0.70-$0.73, largely below a consensus of $498.6M and $0.75. FY13 guidance is for revenue of $2.05B-$2.1B and EPS of $3.25-$3.30, in-line with a consensus of $2.09B and $3.28. FY13 free cash flow is pegged at $285M-$315M. Systems sales (78% of total) +5% Y/Y, services (boosted by acquisitions) +64%.  North America sales +26%, international +15%. As expected, Latin America was weak, -24%. PAY -4.9% AH. Is Square having an impact? CC at 4:30PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • NTLS

    NTELOS Holdings (NASDAQ:NTLS) announced change in payment date of quarterly dividend of...

    NTELOS Holdings (NASDAQ:NTLS) announced change in payment date of quarterly dividend of $0.42/share to Dec. 28 from previously announced Jan. 11. However, the records date remains unchanged at Dec. 14. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • ZQK

    Quiksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ4 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $559M (+3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Quiksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ4 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $559M (+3% Y/Y) beats by $62M. Shares -6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • VIVO

    Meridian Bioscience (VIVO -1.4%) says it's successfully completed beta trials for two new...

    Meridian Bioscience (VIVO -1.4%) says it's successfully completed beta trials for two new illumigene molecular amplification tests. The assays are designed to specifically detect the DNA of Chlamydia trachomatis and Neisseria gonorrhoeae from both swab and urine samples.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +5%) closes higher after Bloomberg takes a look at its upcoming DealAdvisor...

    Groupon (GRPN +5%) closes higher after Bloomberg takes a look at its upcoming DealAdvisor platform. DealAdvisor will let merchants to arrange fixed-period sales on Groupon's site, relying on software to help determine pricing, volume, and (with the help of Groupon's warehouses) distribution. Groupon is hoping DealAdvisor strengthens its Groupon Goods e-commerce business, which is growing quickly as daily deals sales falter, and furthers its efforts to morph into a broader provider of local commerce solutions.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ4 EPS of $0.76 in-line. Revenue of $489M (+18.2% Y/Y) misses by $6M....

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ4 EPS of $0.76 in-line. Revenue of $489M (+18.2% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares -10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • YPF

    Bridas Energy reportedly is in talks with YPF (YPF +1.5%) to invest $500M next year to help...

    Bridas Energy reportedly is in talks with YPF (YPF +1.5%) to invest $500M next year to help develop Argentina's estimated 774T cubic ft. of potentially recoverable shale gas reserves, and is considering a loan to YPF for a similar amount. Bridas is working behind the scenes for a "more logical export tax system" in the country that allows for a better return on investment.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM

  • Fiscal cliff deal rumors are the new Greek bailout rumors. Headed toward a sizable decline,...

    Fiscal cliff deal rumors are the new Greek bailout rumors. Headed toward a sizable decline, stocks get a late boost on a report the President and the Speaker are set to meet at 5 PM ET at the White House. The DJIA shaves its loss by more than half, now down 0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • HOV

    Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV -6%) is down today, despite posting better FQ4 revenue this morning...

    Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV -6%) is down today, despite posting better FQ4 revenue this morning on strong Y/Y sales gains. Net losses narrowed as the home builder reported strong growth in new contracts and home deliveries. Home builders have seen improved bottom lines, boosted by increased orders and housing starts, as the housing market slowly continues to show signs of improvement.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • ECA

    Encana (ECA +2.3%), which had targeted first gas from its 300M cubic ft./day Deep Panuke natural...

    Encana (ECA +2.3%), which had targeted first gas from its 300M cubic ft./day Deep Panuke natural gas project off Nova Scotia by the end of this year, says it is pushing back the planned start-up into H1 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • LLIT

    Dehaier Medical Systems (DHRM -2.7%) slips today after announcing that it has obtained...

    Dehaier Medical Systems (DHRM -2.7%) slips today after announcing that it has obtained Megapixels software copyrights for its DHR C-Arm X Ray Machine. The application is an enhancement to [DHRM's DHR C-Arm X Ray Machine, providing improved image quality and easier image acquisition.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • CSUN

    After surging yesterday on news that China's government would double its spending on the...

    After surging yesterday on news that China's government would double its spending on the industry, Chinese solar stocks are suffering the hangover today: CSUN -10.3%, JASO -5.4%, STP -5.4%, JKS -4.6%, LDK -4.1%, SPWR -4.1%, TSL -1.6%, YGE -0.5%. These companies are still far from being profitable - and what the government giveth, the government can taketh away.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM | 5 Comments
  • BAC

    Recent maneuvers by Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) could mean a settlement of its legal disputes...

    Recent maneuvers by Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) could mean a settlement of its legal disputes with MBIA (MBI +6.5%) is coming in early 2013, writes CreditSights. It's likely both issues - MBIA's claims BofA owes it billions over bad mortgages, and BofA's claim MBIA owes it billions over CDS - would be part of a comprehensive deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -5.3%) trades lower without any significant news of note out. While there is...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -5.3%) trades lower without any significant news of note out. While there is some buzz out on Tesla reporting itself cash flow positive, SA pointed to Elon Musk's self-congratulatory tweet on that topic a week ago. Perhaps traders are worried that with the public launch of Solar City and Space X firing off commercial rockets, Musk is spreading himself rather thin.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 12 Comments
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO +2.2%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral with a $60 price target (up from $53)...

    Tesoro (TSO +2.2%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral with a $60 price target (up from $53) by Credit Suisse after shares have underperformed peers and remained broadly flat since August. "While we don't have a crystal ball on the FTC approval of the acquisition of BP Carson City, we are reasonably hopeful the deal would close," the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • PRAN

    Prana Biotechnology (PRAN +2.6%) gains today after announcing that the Journal of Huntington's...

    Prana Biotechnology (PRAN +2.6%) gains today after announcing that the Journal of Huntington's Disease has published data showing the benefits of its experimental drug PBT2, for the treatment of Huntington's Disease. The results highlight PBT2's ability to inhibit the development of the symptoms and pathological features of the disease in animal models. The drug is being tested on patients in 20 sites across the USA and Australia, with results expected in Q213.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • CRUS

    When Apple slumps on iPhone estimate cuts, it's not surprising component suppliers are doing the...

    When Apple slumps on iPhone estimate cuts, it's not surprising component suppliers are doing the same. Cirrus Logic (CRUS -6.2%) and Skyworks (SWKS -7.3%) are the biggest victims, but OmniVision (OVTI -2.4%), TriQuint (TQNT -2.6%), Broadcom (BRCM -3.1%), and Qualcomm (QCOM -1.4%) aren't unscathed either. Avago (AVGO -1.9%) is off in spite of receiving an upgrade to Buy from Goldman, which cites a low valuation and an expected cyclical pickup in networking/industrial chip demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN -3.2%) says the USPTO has published a Notification of Patent Allowance for claims...

    Amarin (AMRN -3.2%) says the USPTO has published a Notification of Patent Allowance for claims intended to protect the Vascepa indication approved by the FDA based on its Marine clinical trial results. The claim covers use of highly pure icosapent ethyl, including Vascepa, in lowering triglycerides regardless of the drug's effect on LDL-C levels. AMRN plans to list this patent in the FDA's Orange Book.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • HLX

    Helix Energy (HLX -4.2%) agrees to sell its oil and gas subsidiary to privately-held Talos...

    Helix Energy (HLX -4.2%) agrees to sell its oil and gas subsidiary to privately-held Talos Energy for $610M plus contingent consideration of overriding royalty interests on HLX's Wang exploration well and other exploration prospects. The purchase price will be adjusted at closing, depending upon the Wang results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR -5.2%) is downgraded to Underperform from Hold with a $13 price target...

    Nabors Industries (NBR -5.2%) is downgraded to Underperform from Hold with a $13 price target (down from $15) by Jefferies, which says "we lack confidence that NBR can recover significant market share in U.S. land, see some risks to our flat dayrate outlook and lower our pressure pumping outlook for '13." Among land drillers, the firm prefers Helmerich & Payne (HP -1.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • STRM

    Streamline Health Solutions (STRM +1.5%) moves up today despite missing on its Q3 bottom line...

    Streamline Health Solutions (STRM +1.5%) moves up today despite missing on its Q3 bottom line result this morning. The company blames the miss on its acquisition of Meta Health Technology earlier this year, for which, despite being a strategic positive, the accounting treatment for the transaction negatively impacted EPS. Revenue mananged to beat however, for which the company says is largely attributable to increases in recurring SaaS revenues.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • AUO

    AU Optronics (AUO +7.9%) is posting huge gains, apparently thanks to favorable comments from...

    AU Optronics (AUO +7.9%) is posting huge gains, apparently thanks to favorable comments from rival LCD supplier Chimei Innolux. Chimei says it expects 2013 sales to rise 10%, welcome news for an industry hit hard in 2012 by slumping TV demand. AU's gains come in spite of a Digitimes report claiming the company's capacity will drop 7% this month due to a "high voltage circuit drop" at a Taiwanese facility. LCD glassmaker Corning (GLW +0.7%) is outperforming, but LG Display (LPL -1.6%) isn't.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 3 Comments
  • CRL

    Charles River Labs (CRL +3.2%) moves higher on a couple of upgrades earlier today. JPMorgan...

    Charles River Labs (CRL +3.2%) moves higher on a couple of upgrades earlier today. JPMorgan raises its rating on the shares to Overweight, saying the risk-reward is looking good going into 2013. The firm notes that longer term questions still remain, but given the improving fundamentals, ongoing cost discipline and a 10% free cash flow yield, the stock looks attractive at current levels. Separately, Wells Fargo also upped the shares to Outperform on valuation, saying that that guidance looks conservative with the midpoint only 5% below consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +5.6%) moves up to trade north of $20 again. The Nina Garcia-bounce may be at...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +5.6%) moves up to trade north of $20 again. The Nina Garcia-bounce may be at work again after the fashionista posted shots of new lines on her website, while more anecdotal accounts of JCP discounting could also be tipping sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • CERS

    Cerus (CERS +2.8%) says the FDA has accepted its proposed modular Premarket Approval application...

    Cerus (CERS +2.8%) says the FDA has accepted its proposed modular Premarket Approval application shell - an outline of the application process defining the structure, content and timing of each module - for review of its Intercept Blood System for plasma. The agency's approval of a shell was required prior to initiation of a modular PMA submission, thus enabling CERS to proceed with an application that addresses multiple indications of plasma use for the system.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • RH

    Restoration Hardware (RH -8.2%) falls despite beating estimate with its Q3 profit mark and...

    Restoration Hardware (RH -8.2%) falls despite beating estimate with its Q3 profit mark and reporting same-store sales 29% higher for the period. The furniture seller appears to be getting beat up due to its quiet tone on guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • QRVO

    More on Barclays' upgrade of RF Micro (RFMD +7.3%): Analyst Blayne Curtis think the chipmaker...

    More on Barclays' upgrade of RF Micro (RFMD +7.3%): Analyst Blayne Curtis think the chipmaker will capture the majority of an estimated $400M-$500M market for mobile phone antenna tuners in 2014. He also sees potential for RF Micro to win antenna switch and power amplifier designs for the next-gen iPhone; thinks the company could gain share on smartphones using Qualcomm and Broadcom baseband chips, and views low-end 3G smartphones as a growth driver.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • MET

    More on the MetLife (NYSE:MET) update: The OCC has given conditional approval to the sale...

    More on the MetLife (NYSE:MET) update: The OCC has given conditional approval to the sale MetLife Bank's deposits to GE Capital. The insurer still does not have a closing date, nor does it know if this will make the Fed more likely to allow greater capital returns in 2013 (transcript). Wishful thinking? Embedded in the firm's 2013 forecast (presentation) is the 10-year yield going to 2.38% by the end of 2013. If rates stay flat, it could knock another nickel off earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • BIOS

    BioScrip (BIOS +1.7%) moves up after announcing earlier today that it was buying infusion...

    BioScrip (BIOS +1.7%) moves up after announcing earlier today that it was buying infusion pharmacy services provider HomeChoice Partners for $70M in cash from DaVita HealthCare Partners (DVA -0.3%). The deal is part of a larger effort by BIOS to expand its national footprint. In February, it sold its specialty and mail-service pharmacy operations to Walgreen (WAG)for $225M, saying it wanted to turn its focus onto building its alternate-site infusion business.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • ONCY

    Midday top 10 gainers: ONCY +51%. OTCQB:TELK +23%. PRGN +21%. GBR +17%. SDBT +16%. SAM +15%. BBY...

    Midday top 10 gainers: ONCY +51%. OTCQB:TELK +23%. PRGN +21%. GBR +17%. SDBT +16%. SAM +15%. BBY +15%. CLWR +14%. ZAGG +14%. TROV +13%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: RIGL -35%. EVI -31%. HRG -26%. PTIE -19%. CBMX -18%. OSN -15%. MEIP -13%. DQ -12%. CSUN -12%. ALLT -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CREE

    In addition to downgrading Veeco, B. Riley's Bill Ong also lowered his rating on Cree (CREE...

    In addition to downgrading Veeco, B. Riley's Bill Ong also lowered his rating on Cree (CREE -2.4%) to Neutral. Ong thinks Cree's shares, up 50% since July and now trading at 25x estimated 2013 EPS, already reflect an improving demand environment for LED lighting.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • CIEN

    Though FQ4 results missed estimates and guidance for FQ1 revenue of $435M-$460M isn't favorable...

    Though FQ4 results missed estimates and guidance for FQ1 revenue of $435M-$460M isn't favorable with a $458.6M consensus, Ciena (CIEN +1.8%) is trading higher. Few expected a great report in light of soft wireline capex, and a record backlog is going over well. Also, gross margin rose 290 bps Q/Q to 42.7%, and is expected to stay in the low-40s in FQ1. Optical transport sales (62% of total) saw a 2% Y/Y decline and optical switching fell 50%. But carrier Ethernet sales rose 66% and software/services 21%. TLAB +1.5%. FNSR +5.3%. OCLR +2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • AVTCQ

    Shares of AVT (AVTC.OB) more than double after the company reports development deals with new...

    Shares of AVT (AVTC.OB) more than double after the company reports development deals with new customers. The company, which reported strong Q3 results earlier this week, is in the business of providing tech-based product dispensing solutions for major clients.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +3.6%) trades up after saying it's entered into stock purchase...

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +3.6%) trades up after saying it's entered into stock purchase agreements with members of its Board and various institutional investors to sell 7M shares of its common stock in an issuer directed, registered direct offering. Shares were priced at $8.60, yesterday's closing bid price. Gross proceeds from the sale were approximately $60M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • TROX

    Closing arguments concluded yesterday in Tronox's (TROX -3%) case against Anadarko (APC -0.9%),...

    Closing arguments concluded yesterday in Tronox's (TROX -3%) case against Anadarko (APC -0.9%), and Jefferies notes one of court's questions implied $2B-$3B would be the minimum acceptable to the U.S. for clean-up. Jefferies believes a judgment against APC in this range would be a bullish outcome, as it estimates at least $4B is priced into APC shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • INFI

    Infinity Pharmaceuticals (INFI +8.1%) moves higher today after high demand for the shares put...

    Infinity Pharmaceuticals (INFI +8.1%) moves higher today after high demand for the shares put the price on its 5.7M share secondary offering at $26.33, flat with Wednesday's close. The company says it intends to use the funds for R&D costs, potential acquisitions and other purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • TSLA

    SolarCity (SCTY) is saving a bit of face with its post-IPO performance. After lowering its IPO...

    SolarCity (SCTY) is saving a bit of face with its post-IPO performance. After lowering its IPO price to a mere $8 from a range of $13-$15, shares opened at $9.35 and have shot higher to $10.42, good for a 30.3% gain. That gives the solar installation/utility services firm a market cap of $762M. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • CNO

    CNO Financial (CNO +3%) gains in the wake of announcing a $300M addition to its stock repurchase...

    CNO Financial (CNO +3%) gains in the wake of announcing a $300M addition to its stock repurchase program, bringing the total remaining to about $360M. For 2013, the company expects buybacks of $250M-$300MM and dividends paid to the holding company of $250M-$300M. The company has a market cap of about $2.2B. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy Services (BAS -7.3%) lowers Q4 revenue guidance, blaming the current pricing...

    Basic Energy Services (BAS -7.3%) lowers Q4 revenue guidance, blaming the current pricing environment and activity declines into year-end that are more severe than expected. BAS now sees revenue 12%-14% lower Q/Q and weaker than the 5%-7% previously projected sequential decline. BAS reported revenues of $340M in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • PHMD

    PhotoMedex (PHMD +3.8%) gets a lift today after upping its Q4 revenue forecast, citing...

    PhotoMedex (PHMD +3.8%) gets a lift today after upping its Q4 revenue forecast, citing higher-than-expected sales in its consumer segment due to a strong response to its holiday advertising. The company - whose products address skin problems such as psoriasis and acne - now projects revenue for the current quarter of between $52M to $54M, versus prior estimates of $46M to $48M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • RSH

    RadioShack (RSH +3.6%), hhgregg (HGG +2.6%), and Conn's (CONN +1.6%) trade higher as the reality...

    RadioShack (RSH +3.6%), hhgregg (HGG +2.6%), and Conn's (CONN +1.6%) trade higher as the reality that a struggling big box retailer can attract a buyer helps buoy sentiment a bit. The three haven't attracted M&A buzz of note, but shares tend to get pulled by gravity when Best Buy moves.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • VECO

    Veeco Instruments (VECO -1.7%) slips today after B. Riley cut the shares to a Neutral and...

    Veeco Instruments (VECO -1.7%) slips today after B. Riley cut the shares to a Neutral and lowered its price target to $31 from $35 a share. The firm cites a sketchy outlook for the first half of 2013, saying that industry checks show Q4 orders for LED and hard disk drive tools continue to be weak. The firm also had a delayed 10-Q filing, and although it appears to be just procedural, the timing of the filing remains uncertain and could weigh on the stock near- term.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • ALLT

    Allot (ALLT -15.9%) has crashed after receiving a downgrade to Hold from Wunderlich, which is...

    Allot (ALLT -15.9%) has crashed after receiving a downgrade to Hold from Wunderlich, which is lowering its PT to $21 from $27. Allot has been growing quickly thanks to strong carrier demand for deep packet inspection (DPI) hardware,but shares have been pressured by worries about soft wireline capex and the company's heavy European exposure (made heavier by the fact net neutrality laws limit how much wireline U.S. carriers can use DPI gear). (Merrill)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • BBY

    A strong unexplained move in shares of Best Buy (BBY +18.1%) after the market closed yesterday...

    A strong unexplained move in shares of Best Buy (BBY +18.1%) after the market closed yesterday takes on a different context off the news report this morning that Richard Schulze will make a formal bid to the board this week. Fortune editor Dan Primack can't help but call the BBY spike suspicious given the inside trading headline du jour.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +3%) is rallying again today. Shares are now up 43% since an 804M-share lockup...

    Facebook (FB +3%) is rallying again today. Shares are now up 43% since an 804M-share lockup expired on Nov. 14. Another lockup expires tomorrow, but it's for a relatively paltry 156M shares. 12.1% of Facebook's float was shorted as Nov. 30 - a steep figure, but below past levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • QRVO

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD +9.1%) soars after receiving an upgrade to Overweight from Barclays,...

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD +9.1%) soars after receiving an upgrade to Overweight from Barclays, which is setting a PT of $6. Shares haven't performed well over the last couple of years, thanks in large part to the power amplifier vendor's exposure to share-losing Nokia, RIM, and HTC. But it also has some Samsung exposure and two iPhone 5 design wins. (yesterday)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (SBUX +0.6%) drops the price of its Verismo brewer by up to $100 on its website in...

    Lexmark (NYSE:LXK) -5.5% after receiving a harsh downgrade to Sell from Deutsche's  Chris...

    Lexmark (NYSE:LXK) -5.5% after receiving a harsh downgrade to Sell from Deutsche's  Chris Whitmore. He considers the benefits of Lexmark's inkjet exit plans baked in following a 35% rally, notes Lexmark's installed base has been more than halved since '06, thinks an estimated ~$2.50 in ink-related EPS will evaporate in a few years, and is worried about tougher laser printer competition from H-P (NYSE:HPQ) and (echoing the concerns of others) declining printing demand. Even at ~7x FY12E EPS, he considers shares overvalued. (previous)
